title: [COMPLETE] Scheduled Maintenance - 11/03/2015 @ 0500 AEDT
body:
UPDATE : Maintenance has been successfully completed. 

Hi all,

We're planning to do some maintenance to our servers and wanted to give you all a heads up.

We'll be taking the Oceanic League of Legends platform offline for approximately 3 hours, beginning at 0500 AEDT on the 11th March 2015. At this time, games in progress will end in a draw and stats will not be recorded.  To ensure Ranked games are finished in time, we will be turning off ranked 30 minutes earlier than normal, at 0330 AEDT, which allows time for up to 90 minute games to finish.

Keep an eye on the [service status](http://status.leagueoflegends.com/#oce) page and this thread for updated messaging during the maintenance.

Agent Mindstar

replies.body: any updates on when the server will be back up?
It's up.

Are we getting Patch 5.5 this week? 

Would be a shame to see the server go down twice in such a short period.
Unless you can't do this maintenance and a patch at the same time. :(

We haven't finalized the patch timing yet for 5.5, but will let you know as soon as we do.

This kind of maintenance actually affects our ability to deploy patches, so can't be done at the same time as a patch (it would result in potentially a very long outage).

Additionally, we generally look to avoid doing too many changes at once during an outage, to reduce the troubleshooting time and impact of potential issues.
Fair enough! Thanks for the clear answer.
WHEN IS THE FREE WEEK ROTATION GONNA OCCUR
In the patch 5.5 id say

So, rineyy brought this up:

> "On 13/03/2015, starting at 03:30 AM AEDT, ranked queues will be disabled in preparation for patch 5.5. At 05:00 AM AEDT, the servers will be shut down and all games currently in progress will end in a draw and stats will not be recorded. We estimate the battlegrounds will be unavailable for 6 hours."
> 
> http://status.leagueoflegends.com/?en_US#oce

Is it accurate?
Lol it's posted on their official Service Status page.
So I can't ask for confirmation?
Thought the post on their site would be enough but sure.
Not really. I've seen Rioters mistakenly post things many times. If I'm unsure of something I'll ask for confirmation.

Odd. I haven't seen mistakes on any of their service status pages other than typos (12/03/2015) instead of (13/03/2015). 

You guys usually receive the update a few hours after the other regions (which happens to be on the next day for y'all) due to the times your server is the least active. Based on the times all other regions are receiving the update, it's accurate. 

---

As for the confirmation on us receiving a patch every 2 weeks;

> [{quoted}](name=rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=uA826WUK,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2015-03-10T13:39:47.688+0000)
>
> Meddler mentioned it a while back (the part where we're supposed to get a patch every two weeks). I'll see if I can dig it up. 
> 
> As for the March 11th, it marks two weeks since Patch 5.4.
> 
> [Here is his comment.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/V4KTcEy1-xin-zhao-no-more-knock-up?comment=000100000000)

Seems quoting doesn't work across regions, but the confirmation link is there and [here is the thread I quoted, if you're interested.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/uA826WUK-patch-55-release-date?)

I'll admit my sense of long periods of time isn't great, which is probably why I got confused in that regard, however I often don't trust what's posted on the server status page because I have seen things be mistakenly posted there before. Those things usually get picked up on pretty quickly though but nonetheless I still ask for confirmation if I'm unsure. If you have found, for example, a post on the boards about the patch then post the link, otherwise you haven't really got a way to confirm that it is happening as planned this week.
[Here you go.](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/iAqsRo04-scheduled-maintenance-patch-55-13032015)

I understand, though pretty much all (aside from typos) of the recent posts have been correct. Other than a Rioter posting the info like this thread, there's no other way to confirm the patch times.

Trust me on this one though, it's accurate this time. Look forward to the patch on Friday! 

And "The upcoming 5.5 patch will require a longer download than usual. We recommend starting the update as soon as the servers come back online!"
5.4 was two weeks ago so probably not. Most likely we will be seeing 5.5 next week or the week after.

Nope. Patch 5.5 is confirmed for this week. There have been no PBE updates since March 5th which indicates a patch is on the horizon. On top of that, we're supposed to have a patch every 2 weeks.

We're pretty much just waiting for y'all to finish this maintenance so 5.5 can be deployed.

> On top of that, we're supposed to have a patch every 2 weeks.

Not necessarily. Patches often occur 3-4 weeks from the previous, usually 5 weeks if not then. 2 weeks is pretty uncommon for the time between patches.

In Season 3 it was like that. In Season 4 it was mostly 2 weeks apart, occasionally extending to more.

In Season 5, it has been confirmed that we'll be receiving a patch every 2 weeks (as seen with the previous 4 patches).

"On 13/03/2015, starting at 03:30 AM AEDT, ranked queues will be disabled in preparation for patch 5.5. At 05:00 AM AEDT, the servers will be shut down and all games currently in progress will end in a draw and stats will not be recorded. We estimate the battlegrounds will be unavailable for 6 hours."

http://status.leagueoflegends.com/?en_US#oce
We're supposed to receive Patch 5.5 this week.

Yeah, and i got bugsplatted 4 times in a row on Sunday, then my Mac restarted cause of problem.

Problem with game/server or just my Mac?

but what if its a long game and they start about 20 minutes before it is turned off, but the game overpasses 60 minutes and they have their game cut just before they end. Shouldn't you be a little safer with slightly longer ranked shutdown time?
I'm assuming you're talking about ranked, in which case the game would need to last at least an hour and a half (1:30) in order to be cut off.
Thanks for pointing this out Talon12.  I've clarified the OP to make sure this is clear.
always better to be safe than sorry
will this be addressing the constant lag and connection issues that patch 5.4 brought?
